metadata.title: CVE-2020-8648 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
There is a use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel through 5.5.2in the n_tty_receive_buf_common function in drivers/tty/n_tty.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-178-generic - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-4.4.0-178-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-4.4.0-178-lowlatency - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-4.4.0-178-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-4.4.0-178-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-4.4.0-178-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-4.4.0-178-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-178-generic - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-178-lowlatency - 4.4.0-178.208
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1070-kvm - 4.4.0-1070.77
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1106-aws - 4.4.0-1106.117
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1066-aws - 4.15.0-1066.70~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1061-gcp - 4.15.0-1061.65
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1038-oracle - 4.15.0-1038.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1132-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1132.141
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-178.208').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1070.77').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1106.117').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.70~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1082.92~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1061.65').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1038.42~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1132.141').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.144').
